metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7524 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
tpm2-tools versions before 1.1.1 are vulnerable to a password leak due to transmitting password in plaintext from client to server when generating HMAC.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tpm2-tools - 2.1.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tpm2-tools package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
